title: Why Indian cotton textile manufacturing declined

content.question: Which of the following was a major reason for the decline in Indiaâ€™s share of the global manufacture of cotton textiles by the end of the nineteenth century?

choices.label: Climate change that significantly altered the growing season
Disruption of production from disputes with labor unions
Competition from industrially produced British textiles
Religious opposition to capitalist modes of production

content.answer: Competition from industrially produced British textiles
